title: Chao Phraya River
summary: The Chao Phraya (/ˌtʃaʊ prəˈjɑː/[1] or /tʃaʊˈpraɪə/[2]) (Thai: แม่น้ำเจ้าพระยา RTGS: Maenam Chao Phraya, pronounced [mɛ̂ːnáːm tɕâːw pʰráʔjaː] (listen) or [tɕâːw pʰrajaː][3]) is the major river in Thailand,[4] with its low alluvial plain forming the centre of the country. It flows through Bangkok and then into the Gulf of Thailand.
